text: Not moving off HubDB, just considering moving off dynamically rendered pages, but still utilizing HubDB. But I think I can stay on dynamically rendered pages too, just need to rework some things.

Is there no way to add a relative query param URL to the `@HubSpot/linked_image` module? i.e. `?test=good`  should link to `<https://the-site.com/the-page?test=good>` like it does for normal link fields, but instead it links to `https://?test=good`

Yeah, youâ€™re only checking for
```{% unless (module.link is string_containing "{{") or (module.link is string_containing "//") or (module.link is string_startingwith "/") or (module.link is string_startingwith "mailto") or (module.link is string_startingwith "#") or !module.link %}```
:disappointed:
Are these HubSpot core modules located on GitHub anywhere, where we can make PRs?
Bump, still waiting / looking for an update on this.
Yeah you can use it. It's in beta <@U03U053QC72> is the man to talk to
